title: The Block's El'ise and Matt reveal what inspired the racy artworks in their house
text:
Fans of The Block may have noticed a running theme through El'ise and Matt Bothe's renovated house.

The couple have been decorating their home with artworks depicting women in various states of undress.

And in an interview with 9Now on Thursday, El'ise, 33, revealed the placement of the artworks are a deliberate nod to the area's past.

'There's a lot of nitty-gritty background': The Block's El'ise and Matt Bothe (pictured) revealed what inspired the racy artworks decorating their newly-renovated Melbourne house

'The whole story with the art in our house is obviously Grey Street had a previous taboo about it, women on the street - obviously prostitution - and there's a lot of nitty-gritty background,' she explained.

El'ise said she and Matt, 39, wanted the artworks to 'embrace the beauty of women', depicting them as survivors.

But she said it was also important that the art shows their 'vulnerability'.

Carefully curated: The couple have been decorating their home with artworks depicting women in various states of undress

Background: 'The whole story with the art in our house is obviously Grey Street had a previous taboo about it, women on the street - obviously prostitution - and there's a lot of nitty-gritty background,' she explained

She added that the artworks express 'the beauty and strength within a woman' as they do whatever they can for their families and those around them.

'We wanted to show growth in that opposed to Grey Street and looking at it like it's a dirty street,' said El'ise.

She added: 'It's really quite powerful in the story we're trying to show.'

Survivors: El'ise said she and Matt wanted the artworks to 'embrace the beauty of women', depicting them as survivors

But El'ise said she did her best to curate the art, making sure she only used 'tasteful' pieces that would inspire people to think.

El'ise previously spoke about wanted to tell a story through the home's artwork in a post on Instagram.

'To us paying homage to the home and the area was very important... I worked so hard to make sure the story telling of the home flowed and that we could represent as many amazing artists as possible,' she wrote.
description: Fans of The Block may have noticed a running theme through El'ise and Matt Bothe's renovated house.
authors: Demeter Stamell For Daily Mail Australia
